titles.title: Thunderbolt Fantasy: Touri-ken Yuuki
Thunderbolt Fantasy 東離劍遊紀[とうりけんゆうき]
Thunderbolt Fantasy 東離劍遊紀
Thunderbolt Fantasy

recommendations.recommendation: while the puppet animation may look like a bit goofy, the drama is really solid. It`s my favourite show of this season.

At first I was curious, then it completely enthralled me, especially the last handful episodes really did it for me. I`d ask the people considering if they should watch this show:
Give it a chance, if the style of the animation, puppets, effects and all, does not discourage you, keep watching. The drama really solidifies why this is well worth a watch. As always though, this is just my opinion.

anime.description: What happens when you then take Gen Urobuchi from Nitroplus and partner him with Pili International Media, the company responsible for the glove puppetry media with the highest production values? The result is a miraculous collaboration. The result is an all-new wuxia fantasy series, with Gen Urobuchi providing the premise, screenplay, and series composition, and Pili handling the filming and production: Thunderbolt Fantasy! Source: crunchyroll

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: martial arts
tag.description: Various sports or skills, mainly of Japanese origin, that originated as forms of self-defense or attack, such as judo, karate, and kendo.

tag.name: content indicators
tag.description: The content indicators branch is intended to be a less geographically specific tool than the `age rating` used by convention, for warning about things that might cause offence. Obviously there is still a degree of subjectivity involved, but hopefully it will prove useful for parents with delicate children, or children with delicate parents. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: swordplay
tag.description: The act or art of using a sword or similar weapon skillfully.

tag.name: violence
tag.description: Violence is the use of physical force against oneself or another entity, compelling action against one`s will on pain of being hurt. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators.

tag.name: new
tag.description: Not based on anything, the story is a new work, usually made up by the people involved in creating the anime. Generally if an original work (原作) credit is given, it will be to the studio, or director, or other members of the production team.

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: fantasy
tag.description: Fantasy is a genre of fiction that uses magic and other supernatural phenomena as a primary element of plot, theme, or setting. Many works within the genre take place in fictional worlds where magic is common. Fantasy is generally distinguished from science fiction and horror by the expectation that it steers clear of (pseudo-)scientific and macabre themes, respectively, though there is a great deal of overlap between the three (which are subgenres of speculative fiction). In popular culture, the genre of fantasy is dominated by its medievalist form, especially since the worldwide success of The Lord of the Rings books by J. R. R. Tolkien. In its broadest sense however, fantasy comprises works by many writers, artists, filmmakers, and musicians, from ancient myths and legends to many recent works embraced by a wide audience today. Fantasy is a vibrant area of academic study in a number of disciplines (English, cultural studies, comparative literature, history, medieval studies). Work in this area ranges widely, from the structuralist theory of Tzvetan Todorov, which emphasizes the fantastic as a liminal space, to work on the connections (political, historical, literary) between medievalism and popular culture Source: Wiki

tag.name: DESCRIPTION MISSING
tag.description: The description for this entry is missing. e.g plot, biography... Please help by adding it, and remove this tag afterwards. Thank you.

tag.name: puppetmation
tag.description: A puppet is an inanimate object or representational figure animated or manipulated by a puppeteer. It is usually (but by no means always) a depiction of a human character, and is used in puppetry, a play or a presentation that is a very ancient form of theatre. The puppet undergoes a process of transformation through being animated, and is normally manipulated by at least one puppeteer. There are many different varieties of puppets, and they are made of a wide range of materials, depending on their form and intended use. They can be extremely complex or very simple in their construction. They may even be found objects. As Oscar Wilde wrote, "There are many advantages in puppets. They never argue. They have no crude views about art. They have no private lives".

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: wuxia
tag.description: Wuxia, which literally means "martial hero", is a genre of Chinese fiction concerning the adventures of martial artists in ancient China or pre-modern China. A typical wuxia story features a young male protagonist who experiences a tragedy, such as the loss of his loved ones, and goes on to undertake several trials and tribulations to learn several forms of martial arts from various fighters. At the end of the story, he emerges as a powerful fighter whom few can equal. The heroes in wuxia fiction typically do not serve a lord, wield military power or belong to the aristocratic class. They often originate from the lower social classes of ancient Chinese society. A code of chivalry usually requires wuxia heroes to right and redress wrongs, fight for righteousness, remove oppressors, and bring retribution for past misdeeds. Chinese xia traditions can be compared to martial codes from other cultures such as the Japanese bushidou tradition. Source: English Wikipedia Note: Pre-modern China is generally accepted as the period from the 1890s dying days of the Qing dynasty to the early 1930s before the Sino-Japanese Wars.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

episode.title: 迴靈笛のゆくえ
The Whereabouts of the Soul Echo Flute
Hui Ling Di no Yukue
episode.summary: After an attempt to recruit the otherworldly Night`s Lament, the group moves to rendezvous with the owner of the Soul Echo Flute. What they find in his place spells big trouble for the enigmatic Guǐ Niǎo... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 夜魔の森の女
The Woman in Night Devil Forest
Yoma no Mori no Onna
episode.summary: To defeat the villainous Miè Tiān Hái, Dān Fěi and her party will need to get through an army of bloodthirsty undead. The safest way to do this would be to recruit the help of a necromancer, but the person that Lǐn Xuě Yā has in mind makes the others very nervous, for a good reason... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 襲来! 玄鬼宗
Attack of the Xuan Gui Zong!
Shuurai! Genkishuu
episode.summary: Shāng Bù Huàn has no intention of following the sly Lǐn Xuě Yā`s advice and helping in the quest to protect the mystical Tiān Xing Jiàn sword, but when finds himself targeted by the evil sect that is trying to take it, he finds he might not have a choice. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 雨傘の義理
Code of Umbrellas
Amagasa no Giri
episode.summary: In an ancient kingdom, a vicious warlord is on the hunt for a magical sword. Forced to escape his soldiers, the young girl who guards the sword is hunted until she receives some unexpected help from a pair of odd strangers. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 掠風竊塵
The Enigmatic Gale
Lue Feng Qie Chen
episode.summary: The group stands at the edge of the Labyrinth of Darkness, about to confront the Bones of Creation... but Shāng Bù Huàn has had enough! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 魔脊山
Demon Spine Mountains
Maseki-zan
episode.summary: After a brief clash with the enemy, the group reaches the Demon Spine Mountains. Will they be able to overcome the trials set out before them and confront Miè Tiān Hái? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 七人同舟
Seven Comrades
Shichinin Doushuu
episode.summary: With the players assembled, the trek towards Demon Spine Mountain begins in earnest. But Shāng Bù Huàn has his doubts. Can such a motley group, with such naked animosity towards each other, really work together? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 剣鬼, 殺無生
The Sword Devil, Sha Wu Sheng
Kenki, Sha Wu Sheng
episode.summary: With the players assembled, the trek towards Demon Spine Mountain begins in earnest. But Shāng Bù Huàn has his doubts. Can such a motley group, with such naked animosity towards each other, really work together? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 新たなる使命
A New Duty
Aratanaru Shimei
episode.summary: As an ancient evil lies in wait, Lǐn Xuě Yā faces Miè Tiān Hái in a battle to rob him of his pride. But will whoever survives the fight live long, with a demon god about to awaken? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 切れざる刃
A Blade That Doesn`t Cut
Kirezaru Yaiba
episode.summary: Shāng Bù Huàn has lured the Bones of Creation away from Seven Sins Tower successfully. With the fate of the Tiān Xing Jiàn sword out of his hands, will the mysterious vagabond be able to survive the forces of the Xuán Guǐ Zōng? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 誇り高き命
A Proud Life
Hokori Takaki Inochi
episode.summary: Lǐn Xuě Yā and Shāng Bù Huàn attempt to retrieve the legendary Tiān Xing Jiàn`s handle, while Dān Fěi and Juǎn Cán Yún seek to leave the Demon Spine Mountains, and run into unexpected company. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 盗賊の矜恃
A Thief`s Pride
Touzoku no Kyouji
episode.summary: Lǐn Xuě Yā has lied to, manipulated, and finally sold out Shāng Bù Huàn. When the vagabond comes around looking for payback, maybe even the greatest thief in the land has met his match. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 剣の神髄
The Essence of a Sword
Ken no Shinzui
episode.summary: The truth is out, with the mysterious Guǐ Niǎo`s identity revealed. But in the end, who will claim the legendary Tiān Xing Jiàn sword? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Behind the Scenes
episode.summary: A behind the scenes look at the genesis of the fantasy wuxia puppet series with series writer Gen Urobuchi (Madoka Magica, Psycho-Pass, Fate/Zero). Source: crunchyroll
